name: Hill and Vale Walk at Frog Firle Farm, South Downs East

ai.summary: A challenging 16.3 km hike through hill and vale landscapes around Frog Firle Farm in the South Downs East. The route combines chalk downland, farmland tracks, and scenic viewpoints with exposure to wind and sun.
ai.terrain_summary: Terrain is mixed: chalk downs with long-established tracks, grassy trods, uneven surfaces, occasional flint paths, stone stiles, gates, and farm lanes. Expect ups and downs, open exposure, and potential cattle in fields.
ai.safety_notes: Check the weather forecast and be prepared for wind and sun on exposed ridges. Wear sturdy, supportive footwear and layered clothing. Stay on public rights of way and respect farmland boundaries. Carry sufficient water and snacks, a map or GPS, a fully charged phone, and a basic first aid kit. Inform someone of your planned route and expected return time. Watch for livestock, gates, and uneven ground; take care on stiles and steps.
recommended_gear: Sturdy walking boots with good ankle support
Fully charged phone with emergency contacts

seo.title: Hill and Vale Walk at Frog Firle Farm, South Downs East – 16.3 km Hard Hike
seo.meta_description: Discover the Hill and Vale Walk at Frog Firle Farm in the South Downs East. A 16.3 km challenging hike across chalk downs, farmland trails, and scenic viewpoints in the UK.
